preprocessing.instance_selection

Class InstanceSelector

  • java.lang.Object
    • preprocessing.instance_selection.InstanceSelector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Citable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Carving, CNN, ENRBF, GCNN, HMScore, INSIGHT, IPT_RT3, IterativeCaseFiltering, RandomSelector, RNNR_AL1, Wilson72

    public abstract class InstanceSelector
extends java.lang.Object
implements Citable
    IMPORTANT: InstanceSelector should not change the ordering of the elements. Use the sortSelectedIndexes method at the end of the reduction. This class deals with instance selection, a case where no new data representatives are generated, but already existing data points are selected as prototypes instead.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateClassToClassPriorsFuzzy

        public float[][] calculateClassToClassPriorsFuzzy()
        This method calculates the unbiased class to class hubness matrix. Normalization is done by the class hubness counts.
        Returns:
        float[][] matrix representing class-to-class hubness.

      • calculateClassToClassPriorsBayesian

        public float[][] calculateClassToClassPriorsBayesian()
        This method calculates the unbiased class to class hubness matrix. Normalization is done by the total class counts.
        Returns:
        float[][] matrix representing class-to-class hubness.

      • getPrototypeGoodHubness

        public int[] getPrototypeGoodHubness()
        Returns:
        Integer array representing the good neighbor occurrence frequencies of the selected prototypes, where label mismatches do not occur.

      • getPrototypeBadHubness

        public int[] getPrototypeBadHubness()
        Returns:
        Integer array representing the bad neighbor occurrence frequencies of the selected prototypes, where label mismatches occur.

      • getProtoClassHubness

        public int[][] getProtoClassHubness()
        Returns:
        An integer 2d array, containing the class-conditional neighbor occurrence frequencies of the selected prototypes. The first index in the array corresponds to the class and the second one to the prototype.

      • getProtoNeighborSets

        public int[][] getProtoNeighborSets()
        Returns:
        Integer 2d array representing the kNN sets of the selected prototypes.

      • getReducedDataSet

        public DataSet getReducedDataSet(boolean copyInstances)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        copyInstances - Boolean flag indicating whether to make object copies of the selected prototypes when generating the reduced DataSet or not, in which case the original objects are used instead.
        Returns:
        DataSet that contains only the selected prototypes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Returns:
        A copy of the current InstanceSelector object.

      • calculatePrototypeHubness

        public void calculatePrototypeHubness(int k)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the neighbor occurrence profiles of the selected prototypes. This is meant to be overridden in those subclasses which use NSF-s (already have a kNN graph) - as this is slower, it assumes no previous neighbor information.
        Parameters:
        k - Neighborhood size to be used in hubness calculations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getPrototypeLabel

        public int getPrototypeLabel(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the prototype in the selected instances array.
        Returns:
        Label of the selected prototype instance.

      • getClassDataNeighborRelationforFuzzy

        public float[][] getClassDataNeighborRelationforFuzzy(int numClasses,
                                             float laplaceEstimator)
        Parameters:
        numClasses - Number of classes.
        laplaceEstimator - Smoothing parameter.
        Returns:
        Fuzzy votes of prototype instances as neighbors according to h-FNN algorithm, i.e. according to their restricted reverse neighbor sets on the training data.

      • getClassDataNeighborRelationforBayesian

        public float[][] getClassDataNeighborRelationforBayesian(int numClasses,
                                                float laplaceEstimator)
        Parameters:
        numClasses - Number of classes.
        laplaceEstimator - Smoothing parameter.
        Returns:
        Class-conditional occurrence probabilities for the NHBNN algorithm, i.e. calculated from the restricted reverse neighbor sets on the training data.

      • getClassDataNeighborRelationNonNormalized

        public float[][] getClassDataNeighborRelationNonNormalized(int k,
                                                  int numClasses,
                                                  boolean extendByElement)
        Calculates the class-conditional prototype occurrences as neighbors.
        Parameters:
        k - Neighborhood size.
        numClasses - Number of classes.
        extendByElement - Whether to include each point as its own 0th neighbor by default or not.
        Returns:

      • getKNNHubnessWeightingScheme

        public float[] getKNNHubnessWeightingScheme()
        Generates hubness-based weights for the hw-kNN algorithm. These are based on inversely exponential standardized bad hubness scores.
        Returns:
